results.title: Portrait of the artist as an old lady
results.creator_credit: Gail Singer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Paraskeva Clark, artist, socialist, feminist, is her own woman at her own cost. This film is a cameo of an irascible and oftentimes touching artist whose work has won her a place in exhibitions and private collections. Born in Russia in 1898, she eventually married a Canadian and moved to Toronto. Because her canvases reflect a strong social conscience, she had to struggle hard to earn a place in the nation’s ultra-conservative galleries. With Germaine Greer narrating, this film explores Clarke’s early life through photographs, reminiscences and her painting. (Awards: Montrial, Melbourne)

results.title: Portrait of Canada
results.creator_credit: Hector Lemieux, Tim Wilson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A first edition ad cause for national pride, the new all-Canadian Atlas provides a wealth of information about Canada. This colour film provides a well-illustrated summary of how the Atlas was complied ad of the story of facts between the covers. The film takes you on survey expeditions to remote parts of Canada, and to map-making headquarters in Ottawa where a mass of detail was sorted, classified and translated into the special symbol language of the map maker.

results.title: Portrait of a gallery
results.creator_credit: John Sexton, Malcolm Otton, Roan Hannam, Art Gallery of New South Wales and Film Australia
results.brief_description: An explanation of the aims of the Art Gallery of New South Wales followed by a short tour of the gallery. The film covers the history of the gallery from about 1871 to the present day. Shows its present building - the old wings and the new modern gallery section and gives an idea of its major collections, its many activities both public and behind the scenes, and its hopes and plans for the future.

results.title: Porter's magic dreams
results.creator_credit: James Rottboll, Sam Grana and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Brian Porter, surrealist, paints his dreams. The film is an incursion into his very private life, which consists of painting, and waiting to paint. Beautifully shot, with a sound track that shifts from the strident sounds of a synthesizer to the warmer cadences of a guitar, the film moves unhurriedly through changing moods and ethereal visions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Rottboll, Sam Grana and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Point Pelee, nature sanctuary
results.creator_credit: Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Point Pelee National Park, southernmost tip of the Canadian mainland in Ontario, provides a hunting ground every spring for the ornithologist, entomologist, botanists- and the photographer. This seven-mile strip of forest-covered land projecting into Lake Erie services as a main way-station for migrating birds. This film shows many different species of birds found into this protected area, as well as butterflies and other insects and examples of wild-flowers and shrubs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Point of departure
results.brief_description: This compelling and sensitive dramatic portrayal of writer and political activist Jean Devanney provides an interesting view of Australia between the wars and the roles of the new literary scene during that period. The film dramatises sequences which examine Devanney’s important friendships with other women writers, notably Miles Franklin, Susannah Pritchard and Marjorie Barnard. A rebellious woman, Devanney was unable to resolve her conflicting roles of mother, writer and communist party member. She wrote political novels while also publishing “pot boilers” to support her family. Her first book “The Butcher’s Shop” with its theme of women’s rights to sexual and economic freedom was banned in New Zealand.

results.title: TVG-8610C Console
results.brief_description: Console with power cable purchased on ebay February 2020
results.description: The Hanimex TVG-8610C is an early television games console circa 1978. This two-player console has detachable joysticks with 10 internally programmed games (similar to Pong) and allows the player to customise difficulty levels, automation, and keep score.
description_for_label: Console with power cable purchased on ebay February 2020

results.title: Classic Looney Tunes Cartoons
results.brief_description: Released as a 50th birthday tribute to Bugs Bunny, this series of videos are collections of classic Warner Bros. cartoons of all your favourite characters, from Daffy Duck to Porky Pig. Sit back and enjoy the fun-filled animation that is instantly recognisable and famous world-wide.

results.title: Population and the American future
results.creator_credit: Craig Fisher, John Martin and Fisher Film Group
results.brief_description: The official report of the National Commission on Population and the American future, which was created by Congress at the request of President Nixon. Summarises the effects of increased population growth, with conclusions and recommendation on how to stop this growth. One of the recommendations made by the Report was “to bring the working poor and those who cannot find work, into the mainstream of the economic society” - interesting projections into the future (circa 1973)!
